metadata.title: CVE-2022-48560 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free exists in Python through 3.9 via heappushpop in heapq.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8-examples - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8-venv - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
python3.8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.2-1ubuntu1').
